reading.passage: Evidence-based description is a core academic skill. When describing a photo or a scene, strong speakers separate observation from interpretation. Observation focuses on what can be verified directly from the image, while interpretation uses cautious language to propose what might be happening.

listening.note: Read this as a script and practice note-taking.
listening.script: Today we will practice describing a photo. First, list what you can see. Second, explain what it might mean. Finally, connect it to a broader idea.

speakingTasks.prompt: Describe the scene in 'Sidewalk Café District'. What do you notice first?
Explain how the setting in 'Sidewalk Café District' affects the mood of the people.
Predict what might happen next in 'Sidewalk Café District' and give one reason.

writingTasks.prompt: Write a short description of the photo and summarize the main mood in 'Sidewalk Café District'.
Explain the relationship between the people and the setting in 'Sidewalk Café District'. Use at least two specific details.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: In 'Sidewalk Café District', the setting provides clear context for the people’s actions. Overall, the scene feels purposeful because the subjects seem engaged and oriented toward a shared goal. For example, their body language suggests focus, and the environment appears to support that activity. As a result, the mood is more organized than casual, which indicates that the moment is part of a routine rather than a spontaneous event.

writingTasks.prompt: Some people prefer busy environments, while others prefer quiet ones. Using 'Sidewalk Café District' as inspiration, state your preference and support it with reasons.
writingTasks.sampleAnswer: I prefer quieter environments because they help me think clearly and work efficiently. In contrast, busy places can be distracting and make it harder to focus. For example, when I study in a calm space, I can organize my ideas and finish tasks faster. A possible explanation is that fewer interruptions reduce mental fatigue. Overall, choosing a quiet environment leads to better concentration and less stress, which improves my performance.

examTips: Start with a one-sentence overview before details.
Use location phrases (foreground/background) to organize your description.
Avoid guessing; hedge with 'it appears' or 'it is likely'.
Include 2–3 specific details (objects, actions, setting) to support ideas.
Use linking words (overall, in contrast, as a result) for coherence.
Speak steadily and manage time: plan 5 seconds, speak 40–45 seconds.

sceneNotes: Focus on what you can SEE (people, setting, actions).
- Simple: Mostly Present Continuous (am/is/are + V-ing) + basic 'There is/There are' for objects.
- Intermediate: Adds prepositional phrases (at/on/near), quantifiers (several/a few/a lot of), and 1 relative clause (who/that/where).
- Advanced: Adds inference language (probably/likely/might), contrast/linkers (while/whereas/in addition), and optional passive voice when relevant.
Add 1–2 inferences (why they are there, how they feel).
Use at least 2 collocations in your speaking/writing.

scenarios.title: A memory
scenarios.en: Last weekend, I found myself at Outdoor street café. Friends sit at a round table outdoors, chatting as pedestrians and bicycles pass by. At first, I noticed Café tables and chairs, Drinks/glasses, Plates and the way people were talking and laughing. Then I looked closer: their clothing (Casual urban clothing (shirts, jackets)) and their expressions made the scene feel social, relaxed, cheerful. After that, something small happened that changed the mood, and we had to respond quickly. In the end, we solved it, and the moment became a story I still remember.
scenarios.fa: آخرِ هفته‌ی قبل Outdoor street café بودم. Friends sit at a round table outdoors, chatting as pedestrians and bicycles pass by. اول Café tables and chairs، Drinks/glasses و Plates را دیدم و اینکه آدم‌ها چطور Talking and laughing. بعد دقیق‌تر نگاه کردم: لباس‌ها (Casual urban clothing (shirts, jackets)) و حالت چهره‌ها باعث شد فضا Social، Relaxed و Cheerful به نظر برسد. بعدش یک اتفاق کوچک افتاد که حال‌وهوا را عوض کرد و مجبور شدیم سریع واکنش نشان بدهیم. آخرش حلش کردیم و همان لحظه تبدیل شد به خاطره‌ای که هنوز یادم می‌ماند.

grammarUsed.en: Past simple with time marker (last weekend) and sequencing (at first/then/after that/in the end).
grammarUsed.fa: گذشته ساده با قید زمان و ترتیب رخدادها (اول/بعد/بعدش/آخرش).

en.tense: Past Simple (V2) to tell a short memory, plus sequencing words (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: Time markers: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago.
howToBuild: Start with a time phrase: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
Change the main action into past simple (reviewed, chose, played…).
Use sequencing words to make a clear story: first, then, after that, finally.
End with a result or feeling: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: Yesterday, the friends talked and laughing.
Then, the friends checked Café tables and chairs and continued.
Finally, they felt Social about the outcome.

fa.tense: گذشته ساده (Past Simple) برای تعریف یک خاطره کوتاه، همراه با کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده (first/then/finally).
sentenceStructure: عبارات زمانی: yesterday / last week / a few minutes ago
howToBuild: با یک عبارت زمانی شروع کن: Yesterday, Last weekend, A few minutes ago…
فعل اصلی را به گذشته ساده تبدیل کن (reviewed, chose, played…).
از کلمات ترتیب‌دهنده استفاده کن: first, then, after that, finally.
با نتیجه یا حس تمام کن: Everyone felt… / It turned out…
examples: دیروز، The friends talked and laughing.
بعد، The friends Café tables and chairs را بررسی کرد و ادامه داد.
در نهایت، آن‌ها درباره نتیجه Social بودند.

scenarios.title: Reflection
scenarios.en: Over the past few months, I have started paying attention to scenes like this. I have noticed that details such as Café tables and chairs, Drinks/glasses, Plates, Bicycles are not background; they guide the story. I have also learned how actions like eating/drinking at a table can signal feelings such as social, relaxed, cheerful. Since then, I have taken more time to observe before I speak, and my descriptions have become clearer and more specific.
scenarios.fa: در چند ماه گذشته شروع کرده‌ام به صحنه‌هایی مثل این بیشتر دقت کنم. متوجه شده‌ام جزئیاتی مثل Café tables and chairs، Drinks/glasses، Plates و Bicycles فقط «پس‌زمینه» نیستند؛ آن‌ها مسیر داستان را تعیین می‌کنند. همچنین یاد گرفته‌ام کارهایی مثل Eating/drinking at a table چطور می‌تواند احساساتی مثل Social، Relaxed و Cheerful را نشان بدهد. از آن زمان بیشتر قبل از حرف زدن مشاهده می‌کنم و توصیف‌هایم واضح‌تر و دقیق‌تر شده است.

grammarUsed.en: Present perfect to connect past learning to the present, plus since/over the past to frame experience.
grammarUsed.fa: حال کامل برای وصل کردن یادگیری گذشته به حال، همراه با «در چند ماه گذشته/از آن زمان».

en.tense: Present Perfect (have/has + past participle) to connect past experience to the present; use since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: Say what has happened up to now (experience/result).
Use since (a starting point) or for (a duration).
Add a contrast or reflection: however, although, even though.
Finish with what they are doing now (present continuous) if needed.
examples: The friends have already handled similar situations before.
The friends have learned to stay Social in Outdoor street café.
Although it looks routine, the details have mattered.

fa.tense: حال کامل (have/has + شکل سوم فعل) برای ربط دادن گذشته به حال؛ همراه با since/for/already/yet.
howToBuild: بگو تا همین الآن چه تجربه/نتیجه‌ای اتفاق افتاده.
از since (نقطه شروع) یا for (مدت زمان) استفاده کن.
یک جمله‌ی بازتاب/تضاد اضافه کن: however, although, even though.
اگر لازم شد با یک جمله حال استمراری وضعیت الآن را بگو.
examples: The friends قبلاً موقعیت‌های مشابهی را تجربه کرده است.
The friends یاد گرفته است در Outdoor street café Social بماند.
اگرچه کار روتین به نظر می‌رسد، جزئیات مهم بوده‌اند.

scenarios.title: A challenge
scenarios.en: If we were to replay this moment at Outdoor street café, one small change could create a big problem. If Café tables and chairs, Drinks/glasses had been missing or damaged, we would have had to improvise. Someone might have said, “We should slow down and check,” and another person could have replied that we were running out of time. In a situation like this, we should prioritize safety and clarity, even if it means changing the plan. If I had ignored those details, I might have misunderstood the whole scene.
scenarios.fa: اگر قرار بود این لحظه در Outdoor street café دوباره تکرار شود، یک تغییر کوچک می‌توانست یک مشکل بزرگ بسازد. اگر Café tables and chairs و Drinks/glasses نبود یا آسیب دیده بود، مجبور می‌شدیم بداهه تصمیم بگیریم. ممکن بود کسی بگوید «باید آهسته‌تر برویم و بررسی کنیم» و نفر دیگری جواب بدهد که وقت کم داریم. در چنین موقعیتی بهتر است ایمنی و شفافیت را در اولویت بگذاریم، حتی اگر مجبور شویم برنامه را تغییر بدهیم. اگر آن جزئیات را نادیده می‌گرفتم، شاید کل صحنه را اشتباه می‌فهمیدم.

grammarUsed.en: Conditionals for hypotheticals, modals for advice/possibility, and short reported speech (might have said/could have replied).
grammarUsed.fa: شرطی‌ها برای موقعیت فرضی، افعال کمکی برای امکان/پیشنهاد، و نقل‌قول غیرمستقیم برای بازگویی گفت‌وگو.

en.tense: Mixed grammar for higher-level storytelling: conditionals, modals (might/must), and reported speech.
sentenceStructure: Second conditional: If + past simple, would + base verb.
Third conditional: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
Modals of deduction: might/must/can't + base verb.
Reported speech: He said (that) … / She asked if …
howToBuild: Describe the challenge and add a hypothetical solution (If…, would…).
Use modals to infer causes from the photo (They might…, It must…).
Add reported speech for realism: Someone said that…
Finish with a consequence or lesson learned.
examples: If the friends had checked Café tables and chairs earlier, they would have avoided a mistake.
They might be under pressure, but they must stay Social.
The supervisor said that every detail mattered.

fa.tense: گرامر ترکیبی سطح بالا: شرطی‌ها، افعال کمکی (might/must) و نقل قول غیرمستقیم (reported speech).
sentenceStructure: شرطی نوع دوم: If + past simple, would + فعل ساده.
شرطی نوع سوم: If + had + V3, would have + V3.
نقل قول غیرمستقیم: He said (that)… / She asked if…
howToBuild: چالش را بگو و یک راه‌حل فرضی اضافه کن (If…, would…).
با مدال‌ها درباره علت‌ها حدس بزن (might/must).
برای واقعی‌تر شدن از reported speech استفاده کن.
در پایان نتیجه یا درسِ داستان را بگو.
examples: اگر The friends زودتر Café tables and chairs را چک کرده بود، اشتباه را جلوگیری می‌کرد.
ممکن است تحت فشار باشند، اما باید Social بمانند.
سرپرست گفت که هر جزئیاتی مهم است.
